channel.title: 317 Delta Chest
channel.description:
I know this is a sort of dumb question but because I have never used chests I need help.
Heres my question.
I added a chest in a secret location in my server and I want it so when they click it it gives them an item. I need the chest to only let the user use it once.
Any help would be appreciated.

item.title: 317 Delta Chest
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

I have made this guide several Times…

BUT ill make another guide for you…

Firstly you will need to find your public ints in your client.java file
add this code

public int chest;

or if you dont like it or it could be in use idk why but

public int SecretChest;

Yay - ill be using the SecretChest because you said its secret…

[center]Now search for[/center]

					} else if (token.equals("character-brightness")) {
						brightness = Integer.parseInt(token2);
					} else if (token.equals("character-fighttype")) {
						FightType = Integer.parseInt(token2);
					} else if (token.equals("character-skill")) {
						SkillID = Integer.parseInt(token2);
					} else if (token.equals("character-chat")) {
						splitChat = Integer.parseInt(token2);
					} else if (token.equals("character-ancients")) {
						playerAncientMagics = Integer.parseInt(token2);

[center]And add this line after that[/center]

					} else if (token.equals("character-ScrtChst")) {
						SecretChest = Integer.parseInt(token2);

[center]Now Search for[/center]

			characterfile.write("character-action = ", 0, 19);
			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(action), 0, Integer.toString(action).length());
			characterfile.newLine();
			characterfile.write("character-pcpoints = ", 0, 21);
			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(pcPoints), 0, Integer.toString(pcPoints).length());
			characterfile.newLine();
			characterfile.write("character-ZbPoints = ", 0, 21);
			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(ZbPoints), 0, Integer.toString(ZbPoints).length());
			characterfile.newLine();
      			characterfile.write("character-assault = ", 0, 20);
      			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(assaultKills), 0, Integer.toString(assaultKills).length());
      			characterfile.newLine();

[center]now add this[/center]

      			characterfile.write("character-ScrtChst = ", 0, 21);
      			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(SecretChest), 0, Integer.toString(SecretChest).length());

Now you will find something that looks like this in your client.java file


	if (objectID == 2478)
	{ //air
		runecraft(1, 30, 556, 11, 22, 33, 44, 55, 66, 77, 88, 99);

	}
	if (objectID == 2466)
	{ //mind
		runecraft(2, 35, 558, 14, 28, 42, 56, 70, 84, 98, 150, 150);

	}
	if (objectID == 2480)
	{ //water
		runecraft(5, 40, 555, 19, 38, 57, 76, 95, 150, 150, 150, 150);

	}
	if (objectID == 2481)
	{ //earth
		runecraft(9, 45, 557, 26, 52, 78, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150);

	}
	if (objectID == 2482)
	{ //fire
		runecraft(14, 50, 554, 35, 70, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150);

	}
	if (objectID == 2483)
	{ //body
		runecraft(20, 45, 559, 46, 92, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150);

	}

Add this line

	if (objectID == CHESTID)
	{ //body
		if (SecretChest == 0)
		{
		//WHAT CHEST DOES 
		//addItem(995, 50000);
		//sM("This chest has given you 50,000 Gold coins");
		//Then if you would like to take them away from there
		//toX = New absX;
		//toY = New absY;
		SecretChest = 1;	
		}
	}

Read full topic
